cves.description: OpenCode is an open source AI coding agent. Prior to 1.0.216, OpenCode automatically starts an unauthenticated HTTP server that allows any local process (or any website via permissive CORS) to execute arbitrary shell commands with the user's privileges. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.0.216.
problemType: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
CWE-942: Permissive Cross-domain Policy with Untrusted Domains

cves.description: OpenCode is an open source AI coding agent. The markdown renderer used for LLM responses will insert arbitrary HTML into the DOM. There is no sanitization with DOMPurify or even a CSP on the web interface to prevent JavaScript execution via HTML injection. This means controlling the LLM response for a chat session gets JavaScript execution on the http://localhost:4096 origin. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.1.10.
problemType: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
